questions.question: What is C++?
questions.correct_answer: A programming language

questions.question: In C++, what is the 'cout' object used for?
questions.correct_answer: Displaying output to the console

questions.question: What does OOP stand for in C++?
questions.correct_answer: Object-Oriented Programming

questions.question: Which C++ keyword is used to create a class?
questions.correct_answer: class

questions.question: In C++, what is a 'constructor'?
options: A function used for mathematical calculations
A member function of a class
A special member function used for initializing objects
questions.correct_answer: A special member function used for initializing objects

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of inheritance in C++?
options: Reducing code redundancy and promoting code reusability
questions.correct_answer: Reducing code redundancy and promoting code reusability

questions.question: What is the 'this' pointer in C++?
options: A pointer to the next available memory location
A pointer to the current object
A reserved keyword for memory management
questions.correct_answer: A pointer to the current object

questions.question: What does 'polymorphism' mean in C++?
options: The ability of a function to have multiple names
The ability of a class to have multiple constructors
The ability of objects to take multiple forms
The ability to perform parallel processing
questions.correct_answer: The ability of objects to take multiple forms

questions.question: In C++, how do you declare a constant variable?
options: Using the 'const' keyword before the data type
By making it a member of a class
questions.correct_answer: Using the 'const' keyword before the data type

questions.question: What is the C++ standard library function for dynamic memory allocation?
questions.correct_answer: new()

questions.question: What is the difference between 'public,' 'private,' and 'protected' access specifiers in C++?
options: They are all identical and interchangeable
They determine the data type of a variable
They control the visibility and accessibility of class members
They are used for defining classes
questions.correct_answer: They control the visibility and accessibility of class members

questions.question: What is the C++ standard library function to output text to a file?
questions.correct_answer: ofstream()

questions.question: What is a 'template' in C++?
options: A template for creating class objects
A way to comment out code
questions.correct_answer: A template for creating class objects

questions.question: What does 'RAII' stand for in C++?
questions.correct_answer: Resource Allocation Is Important

questions.question: Which C++ keyword is used to inherit the members of a base class in a derived class?
questions.correct_answer: public

questions.question: What is the 'virtual' keyword used for in C++?
options: To indicate that a function can be overridden in derived classes
questions.correct_answer: To indicate that a function can be overridden in derived classes

questions.question: What is the C++ standard library container for a dynamically resizable array?
questions.correct_answer: vector

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'delete' operator in C++?
questions.correct_answer: To free memory allocated by 'new'

questions.question: What is a 'namespace' in C++?
options: A way to group related classes, functions, and variables
questions.correct_answer: A way to group related classes, functions, and variables

questions.question: In C++, what is the 'try-catch' block used for?
questions.correct_answer: Handling exceptions and errors

questions.question: What is the 'STL' in C++?
questions.correct_answer: Standard Template Library

questions.question: Which C++ keyword is used to exit a loop prematurely?
questions.correct_answer: break

questions.question: What is the output of 'cout << (5 > 3)' in C++?
What is 'function overloading' in C++?
options: A technique to define a function multiple times with different names
A way to perform mathematical operations
A function that calculates an overload of data
questions.correct_answer: A technique to define a function multiple times with different names

questions.question: What is 'function overriding' in C++?
options: A technique to define a function multiple times with different names
A function that calculates an overload of data
A way to perform mathematical operations
A technique to redefine a base class function in a derived class
questions.correct_answer: A technique to redefine a base class function in a derived class

questions.question: What is 'name mangling' in C++?
options: A way to scramble variable names
A technique to make code more readable
A way to obfuscate class names
A method for generating random names
questions.correct_answer: A way to scramble variable names

questions.question: What does 'STL' stand for in C++?
questions.correct_answer: Standard Template Library

questions.question: In C++, what is 'this' used for?
options: A keyword to declare a class
A way to end a program
A pointer to the current object
questions.correct_answer: A pointer to the current object

questions.question: What is a 'friend' function in C++?
options: A function that is a friend to the programmer
A function that can access the private members of a class
A function used for mathematical operations
A function that cannot be accessed from outside a class
questions.correct_answer: A function that can access the private members of a class

questions.question: In C++, what is 'new' used for?
options: To define a new data type
To assign a new value to a variable
questions.correct_answer: To allocate memory dynamically

questions.question: What is the C++ standard library function for reading a character from the keyboard?
questions.correct_answer: getchar()

questions.question: What is the C++ standard library function for opening a file?
questions.correct_answer: fopen()

questions.question: What is a 'destructor' in C++?
options: A function used to destroy objects
A function used to create objects
questions.correct_answer: A function used to destroy objects

questions.question: What does 'STL vector' in C++ provide?
options: A way to print text to the console
A loop for iterating through objects
questions.correct_answer: A resizable dynamic array

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'assert' function in C++?
options: To check assumptions and halt the program if they are false
questions.correct_answer: To check assumptions and halt the program if they are false

questions.question: What is 'operator overloading' in C++?
options: A way to define a class
A technique to redefine operators for user-defined data types
questions.correct_answer: A technique to redefine operators for user-defined data types

questions.question: In C++, how do you declare a constant pointer?
options: Using the 'constant' keyword before the data type
By making it a member of a class
Using the 'const' keyword before the pointer type
questions.correct_answer: Using the 'const' keyword before the pointer type

questions.question: What is 'exception handling' in C++?
options: A way to create custom exceptions
A way to avoid errors in the program
A technique to handle and recover from runtime errors
questions.correct_answer: A technique to handle and recover from runtime errors

questions.question: In C++, what is 'public inheritance'?
options: Inheriting all the members of a base class with the same access controls
Inheriting only the public members of a base class
Inheriting the private members of a base class
Inheriting all the members of a base class with different access controls
questions.correct_answer: Inheriting all the members of a base class with the same access controls

questions.question: What is 'template specialization' in C++?
options: A way to create generic classes
A technique to override template functions
A way to customize templates for specific data types
A method for generating random data
questions.correct_answer: A way to customize templates for specific data types

questions.question: What does 'C++ Standard Library' provide?
options: A standard set of mathematical functions
A standard set of object-oriented principles
A standard set of design patterns
A standard set of libraries for common operations
questions.correct_answer: A standard set of libraries for common operations

questions.question: What is 'lambda expression' in C++?
options: An anonymous function defined in a single line
A method for printing text to the console
questions.correct_answer: An anonymous function defined in a single line

questions.question: What is 'polymorphism' in C++?
options: A way to hide the implementation of a class
The ability of a function to have multiple names
The ability to perform mathematical operations
The ability of objects to take multiple forms
questions.correct_answer: The ability of objects to take multiple forms

questions.question: What is 'encapsulation' in C++?
options: A way to protect data and restrict access to it
A way to create class objects
A way to define a class
A way to display text on the screen
questions.correct_answer: A way to protect data and restrict access to it

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'main' function in a C++ program?
options: To indicate the program's entry point
To display output to the console
questions.correct_answer: To indicate the program's entry point
